page.title: 18TOURISM
page.content: Whitchurch lies on the important{ {tourist routes}of the A49, A41,A525 and the Llangollen Canal.Efforts are being made to attract more visitors to the town.There is a{Tourist {Information Centre}in the Civic Centre and the Town Council has produced publications such as "Whitchurch- Gateway to the Heart of England".{ {Attractions} within the town include historic buildings like St. Alkmund's Church, the market and interesting shops such as T.O. Williams of Wem.The town is equally a good {touring centre with easy access to Shrewsbury, Llangollen and Chester. Many visitors come to the town by{canal}and there are now moves to re-open the closed Whitchurch Branch.It is hoped that tourism will grow in Whitchurch and help to {diversify the local economy} bringing trade to hotels and shops.
